alert.note: Alert for Transylvania (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 12:13PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion Transylvania County in Western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1208 PM EDT, Up to 4 inches of rain has fallen this morning across the high terrain along the Jackson/Transylvania County line. Be wary of developing high water conditions, and above bankfull stream and river levels throughout the headwaters of the Toxaway and French Broad Rivers as the afternoon wears on. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Rosman, Lake Toxaway, Gorges State Park, Jocassee Gorges, Lake Jocassee, Balsam Grove and Sapphire. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
